chunks.original_text: 谓岁终助国除灾，安宁境土，遣鬼兵阴助帝祚太平。 又一年内，能驱灭分野蝗虫灾怪，持法除去者，加九天金阙御史。 又一年可发志愿，自於名山建立坛场，投词献章，上祝人君万岁，实有应验者，加金阙上仙侍中。 又一年自了性理，出於物外，提拔群迷，出离五苦，亲诣南曹添注，主圣臣贤，九族生天，万物受恩者，加紫府上相，次玄都大相，次太玄上相，次太极上相，次金阙上相。 又一年通证大道无穷，不执文字，指喝有验，能治江河湖海蛟龙作害，山崩派决，实有利国济民，馘除大孽之功者，加无极上相。 已上自日直元君，至无极上相，计九位迁职者，合授上清九等大箓，方许入此宪格。 余职并依诸仙官，以三元为首。 洞神已下，转行初下元一品仙官。 次知北极驱邪院使中元一品仙官，判北极驱邪院。 次上元一品仙官，判酆都使。 已上有功行果满，次第迁转，身登金阙，侍列三清。 诸应发三清玉帝北斗三光符行事官，变神上奏，具所请事因称臣。 今准式付发遣，愿如臣言。 祝毕，即便给直符使，符到奉行。 诸应行法官，出入常存领六丁、四直土地、监印力士等神随行，以法嘱之，无令失事。 诸行法官，朝上帝，驱瘟邪，断怪祟，须先戴三台北斗，变为驱邪院使。 诸朝见上帝，元正日登黄金殿，春登瑠璃殿，夏登宝珠殿，秋登白银殿，冬登水晶殿。 诸朝上帝，奏请毕，即诣天枢院，部领四天王，十二大神，八金刚，六丁六甲，天蓬天猷元帅，火铃将军，五雷风雨神，直出天门。 诸立狱，须奏闻申泰山，具事仪称述，己於某月日於某方，立建天狱，奏上帝，言五斗狱。 式八条 诸篆天文符录，以天德月德水，六甲六丁笔，黑帝墨，太阳灵朱，五龙宝砚，一如传度法诀，收取奏讫方用。 诸应伏凶猛鬼神，切要委曲神将，仍左右拾局邪诀入，以左右斗盖之，己身宣敕云：汝过罪疏之，吾以救民为心。 诸应奏醮为民禳灾，先奏星宿真君科状，后坐称弟子禳灾集福，延龄命素，代厄衣禄，虔诚置备，知鉴达诚。 诸应上清纲步念斗咒，至天刚住，便弹却印诀，却用天刚印指出。 若以符中咒，唯步斗，以贪狼星起之。 诸祭神，以春夏秋冬四季，六甲等日祀之。 春六甲，夏六丙，秋六庚，冬六癸日，於门户外，以斋果香枣汤三分，供养三界。 直符四直功曹一位，土地先化土地钱，后具述情意云：吾奉玉皇敕，佐天行化，助国救民。 凡行符法，断绝为祸邪祟，治病扶危，作福祈祥，皆凭使者通达上下诸位圣众。 今日资备酒果钱马，以伸醮礼，伏望使者恩慈，大布威光，特垂灵佑。 次三上酒，化钱念咒。 誓功曹文 吾闻夙修大道，今作至神，莫不以功行居先，救民是切，故显幽赴冥，出水入火，变见千途，威通万状，荷戈挂甲，负鼓擎锺，出没纵横，来去无碍，邪魔闻之胆碎，疾病见之安宁。 吾以正法降魔，用汝威灵，佐助收伏鬼祟，断绝祸原，福及良民，功归善道。 今以祭礼，略报神勋，少谢功勤，用答灵威，深劳戮力，伏请各各醉饱。 誓神将文 汝等各宜醉饱酒食，整肃威仪，具严天戒，祇威帝命，奋威武之柄，致平定之功，嘉绩有成，明敦响答。 奉启东岳差来神将兵众，素韬神武，夙蕴机谋，闻望清严，仪德英伟。
chunks.translated_text:
Those who, by year’s end, assist the state in averting disasters and secure the peace of the realm, dispatching ghostly soldiers to secretly aid the imperial throne in achieving great tranquility, shall be promoted. Further, those who within a year drive away or eradicate locust plagues and monstrous calamities from the designated celestial regions, employing ritual methods to remove them, shall be elevated to *Jiu Tian Jin Que Yu Shi*. In the following year, should they vow to establish altars upon renowned mountains, submit petitions, and present memorials to pray for the sovereign’s longevity—with verifiable efficacy—they shall be advanced to *Jin Que Shang Xian Shi Zhong*. In another year, if they attain self-realization of their nature and essence, transcending the mundane, and guide the deluded masses to escape the Five Sufferings, personally journeying to the Southern Bureau to register their merits—ensuring sagely rulers, virtuous ministers, the salvation of their nine clans, and the benefaction of all beings—they shall be promoted to *Zi Fu Shang Xiang*, followed by *Xuan Du Da Xiang*, *Tai Xuan Shang Xiang*, *Tai Ji Shang Xiang*, and *Jin Que Shang Xiang*. In yet another year, if they fully comprehend the boundless Dao, free from attachment to written words, and through direct instruction achieve tangible results—such as quelling the harm caused by dragons in rivers, lakes, and seas, or averting landslides and floods—demonstrating true merit in benefiting the state and relieving the people while eradicating great malevolence, they shall be elevated to *Wu Ji Shang Xiang*.

From *Ri Zhi Yuan Jun* to *Wu Ji Shang Xiang*, encompassing nine ranks of promotion, one shall be conferred the *Shang Qing Jiu Deng Da Lu* before being permitted to enter this system of advancement. Other positions follow the hierarchy of the immortal officials, with the Three Primes as the foremost. For those of the *Dong Shen* rank and below, progression begins with the *Chu Xia Yuan Yi Pin Xian Guan*. Next is the *Zhi Bei Ji Qu Xie Yuan Shi Zhong Yuan Yi Pin Xian Guan*, who oversees the Northern Pole Exorcism Institute. Following is the *Shang Yuan Yi Pin Xian Guan*, who governs the Fengdu Bureau. Those who fulfill their merit and karmic fruition shall ascend in sequence, attaining the Golden Gates and standing in attendance beside the Three Pure Ones.

All officials tasked with issuing the talismans of the Three Pure Ones, the Jade Emperor, the Northern Dipper, and the Three Luminaries shall transform their spirits and submit memorials, stating their requests and declaring themselves as subjects. In accordance with the prescribed formula, the petition shall be dispatched with the prayer: "May it be as this subject has declared." Upon concluding the invocation, the talisman-bearing messenger shall be immediately dispatched, and upon its arrival, the decree shall be executed.

All ritual officers, when entering or exiting, shall constantly visualize the Six Ding, the Four Straight-Land Deities, and the Guardian Warriors following them. They shall command these spirits by ritual, ensuring no mishaps occur. When ritual officers ascend to the presence of the Supreme Emperor, exorcise pestilential spirits, or sever demonic influences, they must first don the Northern Dipper’s Three Terraces and transform into the Exorcism Institute’s Envoys. When paying homage to the Supreme Emperor, they shall ascend the Golden Hall on the first day of the new year, the Lapis Lazuli Hall in spring, the Precious Pearl Hall in summer, the Silver Hall in autumn, and the Crystal Hall in winter.

After completing their memorials to the Supreme Emperor, they shall proceed to the Celestial Pivot Institute to command the Four Heavenly Kings, the Twelve Great Deities, the Eight Vajras, the Six Ding and Six Jia, the Marshals Tian Peng and Tian You, the Fire Bell Generals, the Five Thunder and Wind-Rain Gods, and exit through the Celestial Gate. When establishing prisons, they must memorialize and report to Mount Tai, detailing the circumstances and stating: "On such-and-such a day of such-and-such a month, a celestial prison was established in such-and-such a direction." They shall memorialize the Supreme Emperor, designating it as the Five Dipper Prison.

**Eight Regulations**

All celestial talismans and registers shall be inscribed with the brush of the Six Jia and Six Ding, using the ink of the Black Emperor, the cinnabar of the Solar Numinosity, and the inkstone of the Five Dragons, strictly adhering to the transmission and empowerment methods before use. When subduing fierce ghosts and spirits, it is essential to deploy the divine generals with meticulous care, employing the left and right exorcism incantations of the Dipper’s canopy. The practitioner shall then proclaim: "I record your transgressions and pardon you, for my heart is set on saving the people."

When conducting rites to beseech blessings and avert disasters for the people, one shall first memorialize the Star Host True Lords, then sit and declare: "Disciple [Name] performs this rite to avert calamity, accumulate blessings, prolong life, and dispel misfortune, ensuring prosperity and longevity. With utmost sincerity, I prepare these offerings, humbly beseeching your divine perception and response to my devotion."

When reciting the *Shang Qing* Dipper-Stepping Incantation, upon reaching the "Celestial Rigidity" step, one shall flick the seal mudra and then point with the Celestial Rigidity Seal. If reciting incantations within talismans, one shall step the Dipper beginning with the Star of Greed and Wolf.

When offering sacrifices to the gods, one shall do so on the seasonal days of the Six Jia and other designated dates. In spring, the Six Jia days; in summer, the Six Bing days; in autumn, the Six Geng days; and in winter, the Six Gui days. Outside the gates, one shall present three portions of vegetarian fruits, dates, and fragrant tea to honor the Three Realms. The Straight Talisman and Four Straight Merit Officers shall first transform the spirit money for the local earth god, then state: "By the decree of the Jade Emperor, I assist in the transformation of heaven, aid the state, and save the people. In all talismanic rituals to sever demonic influences, cure illnesses, rescue the perilous, bestow blessings, and invoke auspiciousness, I rely on you, the messengers, to communicate with the myriad sagely hosts above and below. Today, I have prepared wine, fruits, spirit money, and horses as offerings for this rite. I humbly beseech your benevolence, manifest your majestic radiance, and bestow your divine protection."

Next, one shall pour three libations of wine, burn the spirit money, and recite the incantation.

**Oath to the Merit Officers**

"I have heard that those who cultivate the great Dao in former lives now become supreme spirits, with merit and conduct as their foremost priority and the salvation of the people as their urgent task. Thus, they manifest in the unseen and respond in the netherworld, emerging from water and entering fire, assuming myriad forms with boundless efficacy. Clad in armor, bearing drums and bells, they traverse freely without obstruction. At their presence, evil demons tremble in fear, and the afflicted find peace. I wield the orthodox Dharma to subdue demons, relying on your divine might to assist in capturing and subduing malevolent spirits, severing the roots of calamity, bestowing blessings upon the virtuous, and ensuring merit returns to the path of goodness. Today, with this sacrificial offering, I modestly repay your divine merit, slightly expressing gratitude for your toils, and reciprocating your numinous power. I deeply appreciate your strenuous efforts and humbly invite you all to feast to your fill."

**Oath to the Divine Generals**

"You shall all feast to your fill on wine and food, then compose yourselves with solemn dignity, uphold the celestial precepts, reverently execute the Emperor’s commands, wield the authority of martial prowess, and achieve the merit of pacification. With your illustrious achievements, may your resounding response be clear. I now invoke the divine generals and soldiers dispatched by the Eastern Peak, who possess hidden martial prowess, innate strategic acumen, awe-inspiring reputations, and majestic virtue. Hear my call!"

chunks.original_text: 响应镇岳之命来，专讨伐之权震动，则凶魅灭形眦眶，则风云变色，灵戈所指，大恶无前。 辅国救民。 济时利物。 推心事道，宜莫好功。 当院早膺仙诰，素被道庥。 误叨天吏之权，惟藉至神之佑。 上则镇身保命，学道事天，资我身真，冀膺天爵。 中则显扬圣化，昭布阴功，推此威灵，愿成绩绪。 下则救人利物，治病祛邪，诛翦凶妖，兴隆福泰，庶使累成善效响应，幽微德着。 而汝等同分其利，功成，则汝等共享其荣。 尽举当世之便宜，共望正法之超冠。 利而不害，威而有惩。 凡事亏中失顺，害物违天，致讨行诛，芟邪辅正，以终功而胜凶德，以神化而胜奸谋。 某何以当人，孰能御，惟尔有神，辅我大道。 急急如律令。 诸应神将吏兵，以法诀付嘱，常当守护行持正法，榜之本院晓谕。 北极驱邪院当院见管神将吏兵等，系奉玉帝敕命，差拨赴本院护法行化，助国济民，救度群品，咸归正道。 切虑不知本院有天印，方一寸八分，或方二寸一分，或方三寸，或方五寸，管辖天兵百千亿万。 垓印篆一毫一纹，容隐三十六万。 垓兵将随吾印转，邪魔闻之胆碎，病者见之安宁。 上帝赐之，力士捧擎，从吾所行印中兵将，百千万亿垓，来往如风，无形无迹，变化不穷，隐吾印中。 召之则至，或见大身徧满虚空，头戴须弥，肩担日月，手把帝锺，足踏夔龙。 或见小身入微尘中，於丝发内，现大威通，护持正法，千变万化，救度有情，不自伐功。 玄妙之力，道法无穷。 切恐所管神将吏兵等，不知有此法令，故意违慢，遣汝受罪。 不轻当院，今将天兵将吏，岳兵将吏，分屯番次，准备缓急使唤。 如闻当院呼召，急须速至。 如不系当番，或不呼召，并仰潜隐六合之内，自隐自伏。 具下项： 一天兵将吏等，常切准备呼召，如不呼召，不得擅离天界。 南斗天兵三千六百人。 黑煞神兵五万人。 四轮正一部兵将。 放光一部兵将。 天丁众神。 力士众神。 金刚众神。 大明众神。 飞龙骑吏一千人。 斩龙骑吏一千人。 决龙骑吏一千人。 统兵助法神将二员。 一泰山差到兵将，仰分作两番，每一日一替。 参随当院行法官出入，遇有急速干事，不在此限。 仍只得於本院安泊，无辄慢易。 仍委自统兵助法神将，常切提辖。 统兵神将一员。 助法神将一员。 马步兵若干人。 开东岳关到人数。 右件兵将神吏等，今出榜晓谕，仰详前项指挥，遵依奉行。 如稍有违，必无轻恕。 汝等有功，即当赏犒。 具奏上界，赐之恩果。 的无虚示，各宜知悉。 某年月　　日。 具法位　押。 太上助国救民总真秘要卷之六竟 太上助国救民总真秘要卷之七 洞幽法师元妙宗编 辅正除邪考召法 序

"Responding to the Eastern Peak’s command to pacify the realm, you wield the exclusive authority of punitive expeditions, striking terror—where malevolent spirits vanish in an instant, the winds and clouds shift hue, and wherever your divine halberd points, no great evil dares stand before you. You aid the state and succor the people, benefiting the times and sustaining all beings. With wholehearted devotion to the Dao, none surpass your merit. Having early received the immortal’s decree and long been sheltered by the Dao’s grace, I have presumptuously assumed the authority of a celestial officer, relying solely on the protection of the supreme deities. Above, I guard my person and preserve my life, cultivating the Dao and serving Heaven, drawing upon my innate truth to aspire to celestial rank. In the middle, I propagate the sagely transformation and manifest hidden merits, extending this numinous power to fulfill my aspirations. Below, I rescue people and benefit beings, curing illnesses and expelling evil, exterminating malevolent spirits and fostering prosperity, striving to accumulate good effects and resonant responses, making subtle virtues manifest. You shall share in these benefits; when merit is achieved, you shall together enjoy its glory. Together, we shall advance the conveniences of this world and collectively uphold the supremacy of the true Dharma. Benefit without harm, awe with just punishment. For all matters that deviate from the mean or violate harmony, harm beings or defy Heaven, execute punitive measures and carry out executions, eradicating evil and aiding the upright, thereby completing merit and overcoming malevolent power, triumphing through divine transformation over treacherous schemes. How could I, a mere mortal, withstand such trials? Who could resist? Only with your divine assistance can I uphold the great Dao. *Hasten, hasten, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!*

To all divine generals, officers, and soldiers: by this Dharma decree, I entrust and charge you to constantly guard and uphold the true Dharma, as proclaimed in this notice to the Northern Dipper Exorcism Institute.

The divine generals, officers, and soldiers currently under the jurisdiction of the Northern Dipper Exorcism Institute have been dispatched by the Jade Emperor’s edict to this institute to protect the Dharma, propagate transformation, assist the state, succor the people, and guide all beings toward the true Dao. It is feared that you may not be aware: this institute possesses the Heavenly Seal, measuring either one inch and eight fen, two inches and one fen, three inches, or five inches square. It commands hundreds of thousands of billions of celestial soldiers. Every stroke and line of the seal’s script conceals thirty-six myriad beings. The seal’s soldiers and generals turn at my command; evil demons hear of it and their gall shatters, the sick see it and find peace. Bestowed by the Supreme Emperor, borne by mighty warriors, the seal’s soldiers—hundreds of thousands of billions—come and go like the wind, formless and traceless, infinitely transformative, hidden within the seal. Summoned, they arrive; some appear as colossal figures filling the void, heads bearing Mount Sumeru, shoulders supporting the sun and moon, hands grasping the Emperor’s bell, feet treading *kui* dragons. Others manifest as minute forms entering a speck of dust, revealing vast numinous power within a hair’s breadth, upholding the true Dharma, endlessly transforming to rescue sentient beings, never boasting of their merit. Their wondrous power and the Dao’s methods are boundless.

It is feared that the divine generals, officers, and soldiers under your command may, in ignorance of these decrees, willfully disobey and incur punishment. Do not slight this institute. Now, the celestial soldiers and generals, as well as the Eastern Peak’s soldiers and generals, are to be divided into rotating shifts, prepared for urgent summons. Upon hearing this institute’s call, you must hasten to arrive. If not on duty or unsummoned, you are to remain concealed within the Six Directions, hidden and lying low.

**Detailed Roster:**

1. Celestial soldiers, generals, and officers must always be prepared for summons. If unsummoned, they may not leave the celestial realm without authorization.
   - Southern Dipper celestial soldiers: 3,600
   - Black *Sha* divine soldiers: 50,000
   - Soldiers and generals of the Four Wheels, Orthodox First Division
   - Soldiers and generals of the Radiant Light Division
   - Celestial *Ding* deities
   - Mighty warriors
   - *Vajra* deities
   - Radiant deities
   - Flying Dragon cavalry officers: 1,000
   - Dragon-Slaying cavalry officers: 1,000
   - Dragon-Severing cavalry officers: 1,000
   - Generals assisting the Dharma: 2

2. Soldiers and generals dispatched by Mount Tai are to be divided into two shifts, alternating daily. They shall accompany the institute’s ritual officers in their comings and goings; in urgent matters, this does not apply. They may only station at this institute and must not act with negligence. The generals assisting the Dharma are to be constantly supervised.
   - Commanding general: 1
   - General assisting the Dharma: 1
   - Infantry and cavalry: unspecified number
   - Personnel arriving from the Eastern Peak Pass

The above-listed soldiers, generals, and divine officers are hereby notified. You are to carefully follow the preceding directives and comply accordingly. Any violation will not be lightly forgiven. For those who render merit, rewards and commendations shall be given, with petitions submitted to the celestial realm to bestow blessings. This is no empty declaration; let all take heed.

chunks.original_text: 夫考召之法，出於正一之道，故有三五考召之箓。 官将吏兵，本文备载。 又按《金琐流珠》，作考召法师，须於明师受本经箓。 自有三元五行将军，六甲七星玉女经图。 又考召者，为考鬼召神之事，当发心助国安邦，救治百姓。 又受考召正法之师，比世天官，亦同大郡守之任，身法不轻，百日一思巡，巡检世之妖神鬼祟精邪，令不为祟。 十日一存用，思存用法观世界，恐有恶精邪神蛟龙鬼精，妄为祟害，及天地毒炁浊乱於人。 又恐风雨不时。 此等事外，即自理身，常令魂魄俱正，正炁常行，精神明盛，可以长生。 又云，夫为考召法思巡，游天下十方世界，救度人物，常行平等。 为国治家及身救济人物，着功於天地之间，行德闻於玉京之上者，功满，则上帝使仙使迎之，上补为大仙真之位，白日上升自人皇行之，逮至栾巴之后，得道高真，於施持用者，莫可能纪。 窃以学者，世乏宗师，事失原本，不能遵正真之大体，执偏末杂施之小术，故随名假用，往往失之於鄙陋，道隐小成，岂足贵之於道者哉。 若不叙其本而辨其末，则元机妙赜愈霭昧而不明。 琐细绪余，擅见闻於专业，使学者岂得推穷於玄奥，博该通於极致乎。 谨以古法考召纲要之旨，叙之於前，旁助杂术，编之於次，庶乃别其源流，以明於本末者也。 考召六种功德 后圣君告天师曰：此考召法，通於人，以成功德，有六种。 第一能与治邪注疾病，收捉诛斩祟妖。 第二能与人勘天曹地府，年命长短，贫富贵贱。 第三善能与人禁断公私冤对相害。 第四能与人夫妻男女生命相克者，令不相克，永世相宜，出得金木之灾，水火之害，从顺无碍。 第五能与人解除公私咒诅，冤鬼害神，生人死鬼，图谋口舌之害，皆能消之，彼此无害。 第六能除天地灾害，风雨不时，四炁不正，毒龙凶神，淫水淫旱，瘟毒鬼炁。 若非正天行者，此法能除之。 又告天师曰：此六等之法，是太上大道君，结习天地正真之炁为符箓，一千三百八十一阶具足，即今为考召大法。 如此者，是大道上妙，救人济物之大法，能行不欺，不妄立取。 上真此法，功满三千，白日拔宅，家口鸡犬，共得升天。 立坛存师诀 按正一考召仪曰：夫考召法，是考鬼召神也。 须安坛立纂，建狱开门，引绳系坛，及狱开四门，禁步结界。 以香案明灯，於上中夜，禹步步於中心，丁字绕外，结界敕水讫，即西向立，存三元考召正一法师李尊师，存纲头大度师李惠举尊师，存时亦可小声呼其名也。 紫衣飘飘，具冠剑，乘九色师子，紫云从西北而来，绕坛三匝，心存礼三拜。 即与臣禁坛。 又领阳兵往天曹人间，共臣身中，箓兵同心并力，为某家，或为恶鬼，或为治某事。 尊师又领阴兵，助身中箓兵，入地狱及水中，或於坟墓中，捉祟害。 某家鬼贼来到坛中，勘问所由，开启闻奏。 口奏式 追捉臣某，谨依天科行法，愿阳师阴师如无阳师，则存代作本师身，即掐天师诀，令天师降真炁，下身中。 佐臣行兵布炁，放水发火，遣三元大将军师子猛兽，与臣同心并力，共击破某山某庙某贼凶囚，宅舍恶鬼营窟，悉令溃败，瓦碎火烧水荡，捉取精祟，腰斩令除，病疾差愈，某事即遂。 任意此下添事作辞亦得。
chunks.translated_text:
The Methods of Aiding the Upright and Exorcising Evil through Summoning originate from the Orthodox Unity Dao, hence there are registers for the Three and Five Summoning Methods. The officers, generals, clerks, and soldiers are all recorded in the original texts. According to the *Golden Lock Flowing Pearls*, those who practice the summoning arts must receive the root scriptures and registers from an enlightened master. These include the Generals of the Three Origins and Five Phases, the Six Jia and Seven Stars, and the Jade Maidens’ scriptures and diagrams.

Summoning, in essence, involves the examination of ghosts and the calling of spirits. One must resolve to assist the state and pacify the realm, healing and delivering the common people. Those who receive the true methods of summoning are akin to celestial officials, comparable to the governors of great commanderies. Their sacred duties are not to be taken lightly: every hundred days, they must perform a thought-patrol, inspecting the world for malevolent spirits, ghosts, and demonic influences, ensuring they do not cause harm. Every ten days, they must engage in thought-application, visualizing the world to guard against wicked essences, demonic spirits, dragons, and ghostly entities that might bring calamity, as well as the toxic qi and turbid chaos that disrupt humanity. They must also prevent untimely winds and rains.

Beyond these duties, they must tend to their own being, ensuring their hun and po souls remain upright, their true qi constantly flowing, and their spirit luminous and vigorous—thus attaining longevity. It is further said that those who perform summoning thought-patrols traverse the ten directions of the world, delivering beings with impartiality. Whether serving the state, governing the household, or aiding individuals, their meritorious deeds resonate between Heaven and Earth, and their virtuous deeds are heard in the Jade Capital above. When their merit is complete, the Celestial Emperor dispatches immortal envoys to welcome them, elevating them to the rank of Great Immortal Perfected. Since the time of the Human Sovereign and extending to the era of Luan Ba, those who attained the Dao and practiced these methods were too numerous to record.

Yet, in this age, scholars lack true masters, and the original essence of the practice is lost. Unable to uphold the grand principles of the authentic and true, they cling to minor, fragmented techniques, often misapplying them under false names. Such superficial and incomplete practices are hardly worthy of the Dao. If one does not trace the roots and distinguish the branches, the profound mysteries of the original mechanism will remain obscured. Trivial details and peripheral knowledge, when mistaken for the core discipline, prevent scholars from delving into the profound and mastering the ultimate truths.

Thus, I have meticulously compiled the essential principles of the ancient summoning methods, placing them at the forefront, while supplementary techniques are arranged thereafter. This is to distinguish their origins and clarify their hierarchy, illuminating the fundamental and the peripheral.

**The Six Meritorious Virtues of Summoning**
The Later Sage Lord addressed the Celestial Master, saying: "These summoning methods, when applied by people, yield six kinds of merit and virtue.

First, they can heal illnesses caused by malevolent influences, capture, execute, and eradicate demonic afflictions.

Second, they can assess the celestial and earthly bureaus to determine the lifespan, wealth, and destiny of individuals.

Third, they can restrain and sever public and private grievances that cause harm.

Fourth, they can resolve life-threatening conflicts between husbands and wives, parents and children, ensuring harmony and averting disasters of metal, wood, water, and fire, allowing all to proceed without obstruction.

Fifth, they can dissolve public and private curses, vengeful ghosts, and harmful spirits, whether from the living or the dead, as well as schemes and slander, ensuring mutual safety.

Sixth, they can eliminate natural disasters—untimely winds and rains, imbalanced four qi, venomous dragons, ferocious spirits, excessive floods and droughts, and pestilential qi. Only those who practice the true celestial methods can eradicate these."

The Celestial Master was further told: "These six methods were established by the Supreme Great Dao Lord, who wove the true qi of Heaven and Earth into talismans. Comprising one thousand three hundred eighty-one ranks, they constitute the Great Summoning Method. This is the most sublime and wondrous of the Dao’s methods for delivering people and aiding beings. Those who practice it must do so without deceit or reckless application.

When a Perfected One completes three thousand merits through this method, they ascend in broad daylight, their entire household—including chickens and dogs—rising to Heaven together."

**Establishing the Altar and Visualizing the Master’s Instructions**
According to the *Orthodox Unity Summoning Ritual*: "The summoning method involves examining ghosts and calling spirits. One must set up an altar, establish the register, construct a prison, and open its gates. A rope is used to encircle the altar and prison, with four gates opened. Prohibited steps and boundary formations are then established. A fragrant offering table and bright lamps are prepared, and during the middle of the night, the Yu step is performed at the center, circling outward in a T-shape to seal the boundary and consecrate the water. Facing west, one visualizes the Three Origins Summoning Orthodox Unity Master, the Venerable Li, and the Grand Preceptor of the Register, the Venerable Li Huiju. At times, their names may be softly invoked. They appear in fluttering purple robes, adorned with crowns and swords, riding nine-colored lions. Purple clouds descend from the northwest, encircling the altar three times. One visualizes bowing three times in reverence, then declares: 'I hereby consecrate this altar.'

The master then commands the yang soldiers to join the celestial and human realms, uniting with the register soldiers within one’s body to act in concert for a specific household—whether to expel malevolent ghosts or address a particular matter. The master further commands the yin soldiers to assist the register soldiers within one’s body, entering hells, waters, or tombs to capture harmful spirits. The malevolent ghosts and thieves of the household are brought to the altar, interrogated, and their cases reported."

**Oral Petition Formula**
"I, your subordinate [Name], humbly follow the celestial statutes to perform this method. May the yang and yin masters—if the yang master is absent, visualize the original master in their stead—assist me. I form the Celestial Master’s mudra, invoking the descent of true qi into my body. Aid me in deploying soldiers and spreading qi, releasing water and igniting fire. Dispatch the Three Origins Great Generals, lions, and fierce beasts to unite with me in heart and strength, crushing the mountain, temple, or lair of the malevolent bandits, demons, or evil ghosts. Let their strongholds be shattered, burned, or washed away. Capture the demonic spirits, execute them by waist severance, and cure the illnesses, ensuring the matter is resolved. Additional details may be appended as needed."

chunks.original_text: 考召思吏兵诀 凡行考召，先思存师於身之前放大光明，兵士自光明中涌出，领三元三将军，五德将军五人兵马百千万人。 亦可存六甲十二神将大力天丁罗列围绕彼人屋宅，及用备卫把截自己门户，每一门，差一十六人立两边，执刀枪，一如行军布列行阵。 严敕讫，即又存师及臣领兵巡前件，人门户上下，然后结界禁祝，行符牒追捉。 存思治病诀 凡存师治疾病，於光明中涌出兵士，罗海截地，绕天搜狱，与某拔出某人三魂七魄，女人十四魄，得离鬼庭之中，附着本身，令疾病即时差愈。 搯三师诀，在左手第五指第一节是也。 本师诀，第二指第三节是也。 天师诀，第二节是也。 思存行考召诀 凡考召，思师出兵，一一如法。 即存二十八宿罗列於身上。 次三将军吏兵，三元备具，三元兵将具足也。 即搯三将军诀。 诀在左手大指第一节心是也。 毕，即向案边坐，依仪读文，即召鬼神，考问作祟者名字，判付收禁。 如是顽恶，后上赤章，请天兵诛斩鬼神。 令疾病速差，及某事速遂毕，即答恩效，上谢师尊。 考召存祝护身救人诀 考召法师，常能朝旦入静室中，佩带符箓，握诀步纲蹑斗，吐炁为紫云，先盖自己身，令鬼神不能返害。 讫次治病，即存盖彼病人之屋周匝四面，及患者身，以五方兵阵，使之围绕彼人身家，令应验立在，须臾而成，即搯都监诀，存北斗七星盖头，三台覆背，上以□星指之其方。 咒曰： 太上传教，后圣流行。
chunks.translated_text:
**Summoning and Interrogation Mudra for Officials and Soldiers**

For all summoning and interrogation rites, first visualize the master before you, radiating great luminosity. From this light, soldiers emerge in countless numbers, led by the Three Origins and Three Generals, along with the Five Virtue Generals and their armies of hundreds of thousands. Alternatively, visualize the Six Jia and Twelve Divine Generals, the mighty Heavenly Soldiers, arrayed in formation around the person’s dwelling, while also stationing them to guard and defend your own gates. At each gate, deploy sixteen soldiers—eight on each side—wielding blades and spears, as in a military encampment. Once the strict commands are issued, then visualize the master and yourself leading the troops to patrol the aforementioned gates above and below. Only then seal the boundary, recite the prohibitions, and proceed with talismans and documents to summon and apprehend.

**Visualization Mudra for Healing Illness**

When visualizing the master to heal illness, from the radiant light, soldiers surge forth to encircle the seas, block the earth, traverse the heavens, and scour the prisons. Together with [the patient], they extract the three *hun* and seven *po* (or fourteen *po* for women), freeing them from the demonic realm and restoring them to the original body, so that the illness is instantly cured.

**Mudras of the Three Masters**
- The mudra of the *Third Master* is on the first joint of the left hand’s fifth finger.
- The mudra of the *Original Master* is on the third joint of the second finger.

chunks.original_text: 天师亲受，九千万兵。 巡察十方，布炁三清。 神无凶党，鬼无妖精。 人鬼各居，不得有争。 行祸者死，行福者生。 祸福吾知，随手分明。 左指三灭，右指四倾。 勿犯吾道，吾道甚平。 有罪无赦，无罪自宁。 天赐吾法，令吾按行。 莫犯吾威，威猛七星。 饮汝血，食汝精，一切坦平，吾道不刑。 一切毒害，吾道令行。 急急如律令。 咒毕，又闭炁禹步，左手持道父，父者阳也。 男以左手持之。 忽起於手中，如人头戴莲花冠，紫服，渐渐从手中上到心前，如自身长短。 却存身长九尺，四边兵将四象，各各罗列分明。 右手搯鬼目，神目，以朱涂之。 左右手相对於心前，或存身为考召法师，或为考召使，即叩齿三十六通，咒曰： 天明明，地灵灵。 吾为考召主，先天地始生。 巡为天地使，立为天地兵。 祸恶逢自灭，福德见自生。 非但禁虎狼，兼亦摄五兵。 神龙不敢神，邪鬼不敢灵。 指山山为崩，指水水为竭。 指石石走转，指日月为明。 吾身行坐处，卫从十万兵。 随吾手指者，风火电光生。 急急如律令。 三元将军真讳 上元将军唐，讳宏。 中元将军葛，讳雍。 下元将军周，讳武。 五德将军真讳 东，青龙将军，讳孟章。 西，白虎将军，讳监兵。 南，朱雀将军，讳陵光。 北，玄武将军，讳执明。 中央，勾陈将军，讳黄庭。 凡行考召法，救治生灵，清净身心持戒积行。 受佩符录，并如前说。

chunks.original_text: 南抵海门，北到酆都。 太玄煞炁，横天乱地。 上鬼不得下，下鬼不得上。 吾上张天罗，下布地网。 天鬼不令下界，地鬼不令露形。 巡游四世界，恶鬼皆在吾罩中。 谨请三五大将，五湖大将，三元大将，豁落大将，三师门下吏兵，北斗魁中吏兵，河掾吏兵，雷电吏兵，南斗煞鬼使者，北斗炎炉使者，天驺甲卒，威剑万丈高击。 大鼓大威力士，五眼三眼。 六臂天丁，铜牙铁爪。 电目六睛，九头八角，朱发蓝身。 金枪银甲，遍满虚空。 青龙白虎，朱雀胜蛇，猛恶巨兽，飞枭钩索。 天蓬豁落，大力飞天魔王，五方金刚，五方力士，五方吏兵，五方夜叉，五斗下营，八方云合。 五湖七泽，五岳七庙，二十四治坑坎洞穴，等等列阵，步步排兵。 山林树木，细细搜寻。 何神不伏吾罩下，无鬼不在吾网中。 顺吾者昌，逆吾者亡。 慈善者生，凶恶者死。 急急如太阴北帝律令勑。 右法行持之时，先存心火炎绕一身，澡炼形神。 乃想身为考召使，威神赫怒，吼声如雷。 便丁立南向，以两手结天罗地网印，出炁似霹雳，即急念前咒毕，吸炁吹入印中，望行法处抛印。 祝之： 炁化成铁，网如黑云。 暗雾弥纶天地，罩定邪鬼之方。 其罗网印，以左手三指四指五指，句右手三四五指。 右手大指，搯左手大指甲下，以左右手二指开。 念咒毕，即二指相搯，撒向病家。 然后行持，诸法禁治。 照鬼现形法 先令患人立地户上，合眼少时。 次法师用鉴子一面，右手执擎，左目於鉴内存书符一道。 毕即放鉴於案上，便双手结师子印，加鉴面符上。 然后法师持鉴，於自身心前合定。 念咒曰： 天神地祇，万灵同归。 合明天帝敕摄，谨请八方追鬼捷疾使者，速捉为祟邪鬼现形摄。 次呼神名曰： 唵判祟唵判祟判居轮判居轮取判取判锡利锡利嚧嚧。 捉鬼来，捉鬼来，速捉来，速捉来。 急急如律令。 谨请当坊日游使者，追鬼摄。 谨请当坊土地，追鬼摄。 谨请当坊五道使者，追鬼摄。 念毕，将鉴向北照一照，复念咒一遍，再照再念，三照三念。 咒毕，便将鉴令患人吹炁入鉴内，令开眼看鉴内，见是何鬼祟，或精怪，或家亲，或外鬼，悉是一一见之。 存鉴内符咒 天皇，地皇，人皇，天人皇，地人皇，人人皇，唵皇帝君咤利，当境土地力士摄。 天阳地阴，鬼神无处藏。 左青龙将军斩鬼，右白虎将‘军斩鬼。 天丁钉鬼，地丁钉鬼。 头戴华盖，脚踏魁刚。 乾坎艮震，巽离坤兑。 黄头将，赤头将，青头将，药叉将，旃檀将，火轮将，火头将，大力天丁将，无量无定极真君，南方荧惑真君，万应赤帝真君，火轮帝君，火输帝君，火轮帝君。 鉴内符式卷内聚刑，并朱书 右法净身，存变为北方阴神。 阴神，乃九天玄女也。 右手持明鉴，左手搯第二指第一节目，想鉴中出五色圆光，彻照一方之地，无物不鉴。 逐一作法，摄召为祸鬼神，不得逃匿，悉皆出现於法鉴之前。 水照法 水官斩鬼地官斩鬼天官斩鬼 逢水水尼　逢地地尼　逢天天尼　万水不流斩煞无道　之鬼送在南山脚下　受死急急如律令 右法以右手中指，於空中写前山水二字，随手念上咒字成咒，尽以右手从空撮入水中，水用净盆盛之。 次令患人吹炁入水中。 咒曰：当直日功曹使者，十二时神，速摄此间土地、里域正神，追捉为祟病人邪鬼，急急现形。

chunks.original_text: 敕摄。 咒毕，再令患人吹炁入水中，见何等鬼怪，一一分明直说，不得容隐。 吾行太上之法，务在制鬼救人。 急急如律令。 暗处照鬼现形法 谨请天真天洞六甲阳神，六甲阴神，四直使者，驱魂使者，急驱冤魂炁处现形。 急急如律令敕摄。 右先令患人低头合眼，念前咒一遍，吹患人顶门。 却引炁至黑处，如此吹炁三口，令患人觑黑处，有祟是何人。 如却要赴患人体，再念前咒一遍，不念黑处现形字，却念急驱冤魂，速赴病人，借口通传。 其祟即时赴体通传。 控缚鬼法 谨请上清三天力士，八杀将军，急急为吾控缚邪鬼，不得走失。 急急如律令。 右法面北正心，左手搯第二指寅上，念咒吸炁三口，吹病人身，即自控缚。 十二神将捉鬼枷缚考责法 谨请登明神将，河魁神将，从魁神将，传送神将，小吉神将，胜先神将，太一神将，天刚神将，太冲神将，功曹神将，大吉神将神，后神将。 右法变神为天一贵神，头戴三台北斗，面向西地立，足踏丁纲，以左手搯亥上起，周匝至子为诀目，召神将称：急速为吾追捉病人某身中祟病鬼神，不以庙社灶君宅神，凶死恶亡精灵，妖怪之鬼，应曾作害病人者，一一追收，立附患人身体，受吾正法，考问通说因依姓名，远则六合八荒之间，近则不离家舍内外，须管追到。 急急如律令。 右此法，以六甲日亥时，祭醮於星辰之下，用青布一匹，缝作四方净巾，下用净席衬布，用时花、净果、枣汤、清醴、灯烛十三分荐献，具词祭之。 自亥时供养、周戌时一昼夜，读词祷祝，启愿通灵治身救人之意。 仍祭处周回，以茅香煎汤洒净，不令杂人鸡犬触之。 祭毕，取祭物自饮食，余者散於流水中，不可与他人。 若有疾病急难，祷祝贵人而召之，立有报应。 其神将各各统领兵吏，为人救苦。 切在志诚，如法行持，慎不可轻试也。 大力天丁追捉邪魔恶鬼法 先立坛，选真武下降日，受持祭醮。 用净席一领，以净洁黄土铺地，高半寸，令平后，舒净席，在土上上安香四炉，时果鹿脯清酌四分，列之四方，然灯烧香。 法师整服临坛，卓剑於坛上，北向朝礼太上老君，北极大帝，四圣真君，诸位神将吏兵。 次存北帝在法师顶上，於空悬之中，披玄龙之服，戴平天冠，蹑皂履，佩剑，俨苦彩画仪像，卫以四圣。 然后召大力天丁四位神将，各领吏兵，从天降下坛场，歆受醮享。 次读祭文，委曲祝之，凡三祝三上香酒，但不拜。 祭毕，即收摄位牌，於神将堂供养。 后有摄召，一如下文，具威仪如左。 东方大力天丁追鬼神将温玉，着青衣大袖，戴青帻，赤面，手持双刀。 南方大力天丁捉鬼神将李公达，披赤文大袖，头戴赤帻，面色赤黄，手执铁棒。 西方大力天丁缚鬼神将吴天安，身着金甲，头冠素帻，面色黄白，手把铁索。 北方大力天丁考鬼神将刘武真，身着皂衣大袖，头冠黑帻，面目青黑，执戟。 右各依其方，召请祭醮后，有邪神恶鬼作法，请召追捉考问，使之立有灵验。 北斗布炁治百病法 若治疾病，行法之师北向，令患人当前。 法师存贪狼星君身长十丈，着素罗之衣，披发，口吐青炁。 想毕，问所疾之因，随声吸病人炁。 次念贪狼唵，取贪狼青炁，吹於病人痛处，用右手收之后，念咒曰：

Summon and command.

Upon reciting the incantation, have the afflicted person blow qi into the water once more. Whatever ghost or specter appears must be clearly and truthfully described, with no concealment allowed. I enact the Great Highest’s method, duty-bound to subdue ghosts and save the afflicted. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the law!

**Method for Revealing Ghosts in Darkness**
Reverently invoke the celestial perfected, the celestial cavern’s Six Jia Yang spirits, the Six Jia Yin spirits, the Four Duty Envoys, and the Soul-Driving Envoys. Urgently compel the vengeful ghost’s qi to manifest its form. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the law, summon and command.

First, have the afflicted person lower their head and close their eyes. Recite the preceding incantation once and blow onto the crown of their head. Then guide qi to a dark place, blowing three breaths into it. Have the afflicted person gaze into the darkness to identify the possessing spirit. If the spirit attempts to enter the afflicted’s body, recite the incantation again, omitting the phrase "manifest in darkness" and instead saying, "Urgently drive the vengeful ghost to swiftly enter the patient, borrowing their mouth to communicate." The possessing spirit will immediately enter the body and speak.

**Method for Binding Ghosts**
Reverently invoke the Upper Clarity’s Three Heavenly Valiants and the Eight Slayer Generals. Urgently assist me in binding the malevolent ghost to prevent its escape. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the law.

For this method, face north and center the mind. With the left hand, press the second finger onto the *yin* position of the *dou* diagram. Recite the incantation, inhale qi three times, and blow onto the afflicted’s body—the ghost will be bound of its own accord.

**Method for the Twelve Spirit Generals to Capture, Shackle, and Interrogate Ghosts**
Reverently invoke the Divine Generals Dengming, Hekui, Congkui, Chuansong, Xiaoji, Shengxian, Taiyi, Tiangang, Taichong, Gongcao, Daji, and Houshen.

For this method, transform into the Celestial One, the Noble Spirit, donning the Northern Dipper’s three-tiered crown. Stand facing west, feet aligned with the *ding* trigram. With the left hand, begin at the *hai* position, encircle to *zi* to form the mudra. Summon the spirit generals, commanding: "Urgently pursue and capture the ghost afflicting this person’s body, whether it be a temple spirit, earth god, kitchen deity, household spirit, violently deceased specter, malevolent wraith, or demonic entity—any that have harmed the patient. Gather them all without exception and attach them to the afflicted’s body to receive my true method. Interrogate them to reveal their origins, names, and deeds. Whether distant in the six directions and eight wilds or near at hand within the household, they must be pursued and brought forth without fail." Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the law.

This method is performed on a *liu jia* day at the *hai* hour. Hold a ritual offering beneath the stars, using a bolt of blue cloth sewn into a square purification cloth. Place it atop a clean mat, with offerings of seasonal flowers, pure fruits, jujube broth, clear wine, and thirteen sets of lamps and incense. Present the written petition and make the offering. From the *hai* hour through the *xu* hour—one full day and night—read the petition aloud, praying and expressing the intent to commune with spirits to heal the afflicted. Around the ritual space, sprinkle water boiled with *mao* incense for purification, ensuring no outsiders or animals disturb it. After the ritual, consume the offerings yourself; discard the remainder in flowing water, sharing with no one. In cases of urgent illness or peril, pray to the Noble One and summon the generals—they will respond immediately. Each spirit general commands troops to relieve suffering. Sincerity and adherence to the method are paramount; never attempt this lightly.

**Method for the Mighty Celestial Ding to Pursue and Capture Malevolent Ghosts**
First establish an altar. Choose a day when the Perfected Warrior descends for the ritual offering. Lay out a clean mat, spread purified yellow earth half an inch thick, and level it. Unfurl the mat atop the earth, placing four incense burners at the center. Arrange seasonal fruits, dried venison, and clear wine in four portions at the cardinal directions, then light the lamps and burn incense. The officiant, dressed in proper attire, approaches the altar, plants a sword upon it, and faces north to bow to the Most High Lord Lao, the Northern Culmen Great Emperor, the Four Sage Perfected Lords, and all spirit generals and troops. Next, visualize the Northern Emperor above the officiant’s head, suspended in the void, clad in a dark dragon robe, wearing a level-heaven crown, black shoes, and a sword, his solemn countenance vividly painted, guarded by the Four Sages. Then summon the four Mighty Celestial Ding spirit generals, each leading troops, to descend from heaven to the altar and partake of the offerings. Read the petition aloud, offering detailed prayers, presenting incense and wine three times without bowing. After the ritual, gather the spirit tablets and enshrine them in the spirit generals’ hall. For subsequent summonings, follow the procedures below, observing the proper decorum.

**Eastern Mighty Celestial Ding Pursuing Ghost General Wen Yu**
Clad in a green robe with wide sleeves, wearing a green headscarf, his face red, he wields twin blades.

**Southern Mighty Celestial Ding Capturing Ghost General Li Gongda**
Draped in a red-patterned wide-sleeved robe, wearing a red headscarf, his face reddish-yellow, he brandishes an iron staff.

**Western Mighty Celestial Ding Binding Ghost General Wu Tian’an**
Dressed in golden armor, wearing a plain headscarf, his face yellow-white, he holds an iron chain.

**Northern Mighty Celestial Ding Interrogating Ghost General Liu Wuzhen**
Clad in a black wide-sleeved robe, wearing a black headscarf, his face dark and ashen, he wields a halberd.

After invoking and offering to each according to their direction, if malevolent spirits or ghosts employ sorcery, summon the generals to pursue, capture, and interrogate them—they will respond with immediate efficacy.

**Northern Dipper Qi-Directing Method for Curing All Illnesses**
To treat illness, the officiant faces north with the patient before them. The officiant visualizes the Star Lord Tanlang, ten *zhang* tall, clad in plain silk robes, hair unbound, exhaling blue qi. Upon completing the visualization, inquire about the cause of the illness, then inhale the patient’s qi. Next, recite *Om* to Tanlang, draw in his blue qi, and blow it onto the patient’s afflicted area. With the right hand, gather the qi and recite the incantation:

**Mountain-Character Seal for Revealing Ghosts**
With the left hand, form the Mountain-Character seal, cover its face with a silk cloth, and face the northeast. Recite the incantation thrice, draw the true *qi* of the profound darkness, and blow it upon the patient’s crown. Instruct the patient to close their eyes and cough, then gather the *qi* with the sound and blow it upon the seal. Have the patient open their eyes to gaze upon it, and they will see the ghost of the afflicting spirit.

Should possession be required, have the patient close their eyes again. With the right hand, form the Sword mudra and drive it into the crown. Then recite the Ghost-Summoning Incantation:
*Azure and numinous, swiftly descend, flying soul—*
*Enter the sickened body, reveal your name!*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

Recite this thrice, draw three breaths of the firmament’s *qi*, and blow them upon the patient’s crown. Command the ghost to be bound beneath the cangue, and it will naturally transmit its confession.

**Solar Needle Method**
The sun of heaven and earth,
the divine radiance of the lunar horn—
wash away corpse-illness,
dispel pernicious *qi* to annihilation.
*Swiftly, swiftly, strike and seize!*

Fashion a needle from jujube wood struck by thunder, three *cun* and six *fen* in length. When treating illness, pass it through incense smoke. Hold the needle in the right hand, press the left hand’s third fingernail with the thumb, raise it before the heart, and gaze upon the sun. Recite the above incantation thrice in a single breath, then draw *qi* and blow it upon the needle. Pierce all painful and afflicted areas—none shall fail to respond.

**Firmament’s Canopy for Quelling Frenzied Malevolence**
If one raves, runs amok, shouts, laughs, or charges at others, swiftly identify the direction pointed by the Living Brilliance of the Firmament. Strike the teeth thrice, press the left thumb upon the second fingernail, hold the breath, and visualize the Great Sage of the Firmament: hair unbound, clad in plain robes, barefoot, wielding a sword, a nine-colored halo blazing from his crown, flames swirling fiercely around the blade. Upon completion of the vision, inscribe a talisman in the air with the right hand and recite the incantation:
*Firmament, numinous and bright,*
*seize and bind ghosts and spirits by decree!*
Recite this thrice in a single breath, draw *qi*, and spray it upon the afflicted. The possessed will submit at once, or bind their own head and beg for mercy. When finished, burn the talisman as described below.

**Jujube Charm for Curing All Illnesses**
Wash jujubes clean with fragrant water, any quantity will suffice. On the third or seventh day of the lunar cycle, within a purified chamber or before an altar of merit, burn incense and bow in reverence. Stand facing north, split the jujube, and recite the incantation:
*Your servant humbly invokes the Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven,*
*swiftly dispatch the Fire Dragon to seize!*
Upon completion, visualize the Perfected Warrior, draw the true *qi* of azure, and blow it upon the jujube. For all illnesses, chew the jujube while reciting the charm over water—none shall fail to respond.

**Northern Emperor’s Seven-Star Elbow *Qi*-Dispersing Method**
This method is to be received and practiced on the days of *jiazi* or *gengshen*, one’s natal day, or the dawn of the third or seventh day of the lunar cycle. Take a length of pure hemp cord, as thick as three fingers, and comb it smooth with a clean wooden comb. Prepare twenty-five strands of five-colored silk thread (or five strands if fewer are available), and a single ancient coin with four characters. With the left hand, twist the thread and coin together into a cord, threading the coin and tying a knot while reciting the incantation once:
*Star of the Well, Star of the Well,*
*Star of Metal, Star of Metal.*
*Lost soul, lost soul,*
*hun-soul, po-soul, hun-soul, po-soul.*
*I humbly invoke the true fire of the southern quarter,*
*to aid your disciple’s hanging method.*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

The following day at sunrise, receive and practice the method as before.

chunks.original_text: 受持毕，每用时，於钱眼内穿过，於肘后叩之。 每禁疼痛等，取炁一口，以手紧系之，立验。 若禁制鬼神，断除邪怪，镇压凶宅，以物句挂於正堂及鬼神显应来路上，其鬼立去。 佩带不得入神庙，并忌妇人鸡犬杂物触之。 天师考灶纂鬼法 用木一尺二寸，作三级为坛，化作三台星。 存身为考召法师，外踏七元纲至灶前。 下纂时，先令家长把纂，师自於地上书鬼字一个，念开天门，闭地户，留人门，塞鬼路。 绕鬼字转三转，念唐葛周三将军急上。 急便令家长将纂於灶上打三下，便自接取，想二使者打到灶君，使去鬼字上下纂，打七下，念□□□□□□□后，於纂头上结狱印，一道牢头纽鬼印，存追打灶君，纽在狱中，却用付狱纽鬼印。 存再纽定灶君，然后戒灶君曰： 咄咄咄，汝是张喏之子，上帝封汝为灶君，合保护家门，何得放入外鬼，为祸搔扰宅舍，立须发遣远去，若不遵吾言，当申奏上帝北帝，牒天曹，莫言不道，急急发遣外鬼，速去不得久停，罪有归处。 三日起纂，烧钱与阿钵罗二使者。 如用纽鬼印，先念日月二君咒，然后踏天刚。 大圣太阳太阴，愿降毫光，本色真炁，入臣纽鬼印中。 纽鬼印 辰，辰上挑出。 艮，中指中节。 寅， 阴日右手，阳日左手，交加样下。 禁鬼火牢法 其上，於东南地户上，用细灰先布一重平地，圆三尺六寸，开南门。 又灰一重，开北门。 其鬼驱自北门入，其南门，以灰书火字於门口，后闭牢门时，亦使灰书火字闭之。 火牢图 立火牢咒 谨请南方火铃神将，火铃吏兵，从天降下，为吾闭定狱门，驱缚邪鬼，戮加考刑。 急急如律令。 咒毕，吸炁吹入牢内。 法师置牢之时，先存身为朱陵大帝，左手搯三指甲下，足蹑丁纲而咒之。 如鬼邪凶恶，加以当日考鬼人数多者，或有未了邪祟之事，即驱入火牢焚之。 锁门法 天杀皇皇，地摄正方。 千邪万鬼，谁复敢藏。 飞步一吸，万鬼灭亡。 左魁右□神圣摄。 锁着不管走透，神将疾锁。 吾奉北帝勑。 此法若人来投状，称有邪祟作害，法师先变神，接押了，候发遣。 投状人出门，法师随手结锁印，三步丁纲，呼神将，取天刚炁，向西北念三遍。 再取日脚炁吹印，往患人住处方位，默言：神将疾与锁着，不管稍有走透。 想四直六甲力士往彼围定，锁下鬼祟。 北斗入门护身法 北斗七星，吾召汝名。 凶神伏尸，土鬼潜形。 八王所随所出地兵，千里谨护吾身。 急急如律令。 右法师至患家，入门行数步，存身为真武，披发仗剑。 四直使者，天关地轴，仪仗随从。 以左手结斗印，默念法三遍。 至患人家厅上坐，令驱患邪人出来，勘问子细施行。 四灵捉鬼法 钟真子景，降冤列圣。 急急四灵，三昧降真。 四位神将，速捉冤魂。 急急如律令。 右令患人当面立，令合眼。 次法师面北，左手搯卯文，念法三遍，取四方炁各一口，吸水少许，同炁噀患人面上，喝神将疾捉鬼付体。 身战，是验也。 又捉法 谨请南方真君，在於丙地，急降真火，入吾水中。 天猷天杀，助吾咒力，助吾道法，速捉鬼神。 急急如律令。 右面南，左手搯斗诀，右手搯子文。 持净水一椀，吸太阳真炁一口，念法三遍，取四方炁各一口，吹於水内。 次想南方火炎连天，一炁吸入口中，吹於水内，如此作法三遍。

Upon completing the ritual, when employing the method, thread the cord through the coin’s hole and tap it behind the elbow. For suppressing pain and the like, draw in a breath of *qi*, tightly bind it with the hand, and the effect will manifest immediately.

To restrain ghosts and spirits, dispel malevolent entities, or suppress inauspicious dwellings, hang the cord on the main hall’s beam or along the path where ghosts and spirits manifest—they will depart at once. Do not wear it when entering sacred temples, and avoid contact with women, chickens, dogs, or miscellaneous objects.

**Heavenly Master’s Method for Interrogating the Stove and Binding Ghosts**
Use a piece of wood, one foot and two inches in length, fashioned into a three-tiered altar, representing the Three Terraces stars. Visualize yourself as the Interrogating Summoner, stepping upon the Seven Primes’ Net before the stove. When binding the ghost, first have the head of the household hold the binding cord while the master writes the character for "ghost" on the ground, reciting:
*Open the Gate of Heaven, close the Door of Earth,*
*leave the Human Gate, block the Ghostly Path.*
Circle the "ghost" character three times, then recite:
*Generals Tang, Ge, and Zhou, hasten forth!*
Immediately have the head of the household strike the stove three times with the cord, then take it back. Envision the two messengers striking the Stove Lord, forcing him to bind the ghost beneath the character. Strike seven times, reciting [missing characters], then tie the Prison Seal at the cord’s end, followed by the Secure Head and Ghost-Binding Seals. Visualize the Stove Lord bound in prison, then apply the Ghost-Binding Seal again to secure him. Admonish the Stove Lord thus:
*Ho! Ho! Ho! You are a descendant of Zhang Nuo,*
*sealed by the Celestial Emperor as the Stove Lord,*
*charged with protecting this household.*
*How dare you allow foreign ghosts to enter,*
*bringing misfortune and disturbance to this dwelling?*
*Depart at once! Should you disobey,*
*I shall report you to the Celestial Emperor and the Northern Emperor,*
*file a petition to the Heavenly Bureau.*
*Do not say you were not warned!*
*Swiftly expel the foreign ghosts—*
*go at once, do not linger, or the blame shall be yours!*

After three days, lift the binding cord and burn spirit money for the two messengers, Ābōluó. When using the Ghost-Binding Seal, first recite the Sun and Moon Lords’ incantation, then step upon the Celestial Net.

*Great Sage Sun, Great Sage Moon,*
*descend with your radiant light,*
*your true *qi* of original form,*
*enter my Ghost-Binding Seal.*

**Ghost-Binding Seal**
*Chén*: raise the stroke upward from the second horizontal.
*Gèn*: press the middle joint of the middle finger.
*Yín*: on yin days, use the right hand; on yang days, the left, crossing them in application.

**Method for Imprisoning Ghosts in the Fire Prison**
On the southeastern *dìhù* (Earth Door), first spread a layer of fine ash to form a level circle three feet and six inches in diameter, leaving the southern gate open. Add another layer of ash, leaving the northern gate open. Drive the ghost in through the northern gate, then write the character for "fire" at the southern gate’s entrance with ash. When closing the prison gate, again write "fire" to seal it.

**Diagram of the Fire Prison**
**Incantation for Erecting the Fire Prison**
*Humbly invoke the Fire Bell Generals and Fire Bell Officers of the southern quarter,*
*descend from heaven to close my prison gate,*
*drive and bind malevolent ghosts,*
*subject them to interrogation and punishment.*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

Upon reciting, draw in *qi* and blow it into the prison. When the master establishes the prison, first visualize himself as the Great Emperor of Zhūlíng, pressing the nail of the left hand’s third finger, stepping upon the *Dīng* Net while reciting the incantation. If the ghost is particularly fierce, or if many ghosts are to be interrogated that day, or if unresolved malevolent matters persist, drive them into the Fire Prison to be incinerated.

**Method for Locking the Gate**
*The might of Heaven slays, the power of Earth seizes the true direction.*
*A thousand evils, ten thousand ghosts—who dares remain hidden?*
*With a single step and a breath drawn, all ghosts perish.*
*Left Kuí, right [missing character], the divine powers seize.*
*Lock them so none escape—*
*the divine generals swiftly bind them.*
*I act by the Northern Emperor’s decree.*

If someone petitions claiming harm from malevolent forces, the master first transforms into a deity to receive and restrain them, then proceeds with the dispatch. As the petitioner exits, the master forms the Locking Seal with his hand, takes three steps upon the *Dīng* Net, summons the divine generals, and draws the *qi* of the Celestial Net, reciting three times toward the northwest. Then, drawing the *qi* of the sun’s rays, he blows it onto the seal and directs it toward the afflicted person’s dwelling, silently commanding:
*Divine generals, swiftly lock them—*
*let none escape the slightest gap.*
Envision the Four Upright and Six *Jiǎ* warriors surrounding the place, locking down the malevolent ghosts.

**Northern Dipper’s Method for Entering a House to Protect the Body**
*Northern Dipper’s seven stars, I call you by name.*
*Malevolent spirits and lingering corpses, earthbound ghosts—hide your forms!*
*The Eight Kings’ soldiers, wherever I go,*
*guard my body for a thousand miles.*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

When the master arrives at the afflicted household, after entering and taking several steps, he visualizes himself as True Warrior, hair unbound and sword in hand, with the Four Upright Messengers, the Celestial Pivot, the Earthly Axis, and their retinue following. Forming the Dipper Seal with his left hand, he silently recites the incantation three times. Upon reaching the main hall, he sits and commands the afflicted person to be brought forth for questioning and treatment.

**Four Numinous Powers’ Method for Seizing Ghosts**
*Zhōng the True, Zǐ the Scenic, descend with the wronged and the sagely hosts.*
*Swiftly, Four Numinous Powers, in samādhi descend with truth!*
*Four divine generals, seize the wronged souls at once!*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

Have the afflicted person stand facing the master with eyes closed. The master then faces north, presses the *mǎo* trigram with his left hand, recites the incantation three times, draws a breath of *qi* from each of the four directions, takes a sip of water, and together with the *qi*, sprays it onto the afflicted person’s face, shouting:
*Divine generals, swiftly seize the ghost and deliver it into this body!*
If the body trembles, it is a sign of efficacy.

**Another Seizing Method**
*Humbly invoke the True Lord of the South, present in the bǐng direction,*
*swiftly descend with true fire into my water.*
*Heavenly Strategist, Heavenly Slayer,*
*aid my incantation’s power, aid my Daoist method,*
*seize the ghosts and spirits at once!*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

Face south, press the Dipper Seal with the left hand and the *zǐ* trigram with the right. Hold a bowl of pure water, draw in a breath of true *qi* from the sun, recite the incantation three times, and draw a breath of *qi* from each of the four directions, blowing them into the water. Then, envision the southern fire blazing across the sky, draw in a breath, and blow it into the water. Perform this method three times.

Then have the afflicted person drink the water, and they will tremble immediately. If you do not wish to subject them to interrogation, do not let them consume the ritual water; instead, the ritual master should inhale it, then spray it into a dim place and ask the afflicted what malevolent spirit they see.

**Binding Ghost Method**
*Humbly invoke the Northern Emperor, the gods of Fengdu.*
*Northern Emperor, Divine Lord,*
*aid the enactment of my sacred method,*
*seize and bind the pernicious spirits.*
*Humbly invoke the Great Divine Warden of Heavenly Prison,*
*let the binding method descend upon the heavenly prison,*
*with iron chains, swiftly bind the ghost’s hands.*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

Face north and perform the malevolent gesture. With both hands, form the Binding Ghost Seal, recite the incantation three times, draw in three breaths of *qi*, take a small sip of water, and spray it onto the afflicted person’s face. Command the divine generals to seize their head and bind it. When the binding takes effect, simply say, *"Bind tightly."*

**Pillory Ghost Method**
*Humbly invoke the Year Regulator, Month Regulator, Day Regulator, Hour Regulator,*
*the Six Yin Jiazi, the Six Yang Jiazi,*
*the Three Yang Assembly Chiefs,*
*the Earth Lords of the Nine Provinces,*
*the Four Mighty Ones, the Eight Vajras,*
*the Twelve Hourly Messengers—*
*now command them to place the ghost in the pillory for me.*
*I act by the decree of the Northern Emperor.*

After the malevolent spirit is seized, if it refuses to speak, the ritual master should face north, press the Ghost Eye Seal with the left hand, recite the previous incantation, and inscribe a Pillory Ghost Talisman. When the incantation and brushstroke are complete, recite the incantation again, burn the talisman to ashes, blow them onto the afflicted person’s head, and shout: *"Pillory it!"*

**Pillory Ghost Talisman Form**

**Alternative Method**
*Humbly invoke the Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper, the Heavenly Vajra Great Gods.*
*To the left, drive the Six Jia; to the right, drive the Six Ding.*
*Let the Dingmao swiftly command the ghostly Ding to pursue the soul,*
*let the Four Great Divine Continents seize and pillory it,*
*swiftly affix it to the ghost’s body, the ghost to the person’s body.*
*The iron pillory has arrived, its weight a thousand *jin*.*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

For this method, borrow a pillory from a nearby City God’s sacred temple. First, face north and recite the incantation three times. With the left hand, press the Celestial Stem Seal and blow toward the direction of the pillory’s location. Then, with both hands, form the Pillory Ghost Seal, recite the incantation three times, draw in a breath of *qi*, and blow it onto the afflicted person’s neck. Envision the divine generals pillorying the ghost and shout: *"Swiftly!"*

**Five Dipper Interrogation Method**
*Humbly invoke the true *qi* of the Five Dippers,*
*by the Northern Emperor’s decree, let it be enacted,*
*to distinguish the malevolent spirits.*
*Now impose the penal code,*
*swiftly interrogate the ghost’s body.*
*Beneath my hand: the Four Mighty Ones, the Eight Vajras,*
*the Heavenly Vajra Great Generals, the Heavenly Ding Warriors,*
*the Heavenly Prison Great Divine Warden—*
*swiftly interrogate the ghost to reveal its name.*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

Alternatively, the ritual master should face north, holding three interrogation rods. Recite the incantation three times, draw in a breath of *qi* from each of the five directions, and blow them onto the rods. Place one rod on the afflicted person’s back and the other two beside their legs. Recite the incantation once more, draw in a breath of Heavenly Vajra *qi*, blow it out, and command the divine generals to strike.

**Alternative Method**
*Humbly invoke the true *qi* of the Black Slayer of the North to descend in spirit,*
*wielding an iron rod to interrogate the ghost and reveal its name.*
*Interrogate the ghost to eradicate its root,*
*strike the ghost to sever its form.*
*Heaven turns, earth splits,*
*humans live, ghosts perish.*
*When the method arrives, let it be enacted.*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

For this method, use the rods as before and draw in a breath of Heavenly Vajra *qi* to blow upon them.

**Suppressing Ghost Method**
*Humbly invoke the Great Might of Heavenly Origin, the Great Might General,*
*the Great Might of Heavenly Light, the Great Might General,*
*the Great Might of Heavenly Impulse, the Great Might General,*
*the Great Might of Great Unity, the Great Might General.*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance, seize it!*

The ritual master should face the Heavenly Gate, form the Mountain Character Seal with the left hand, and hold paper and brush in the right. Recite the incantation three times, draw in a breath of *qi*, and blow it onto the seal on the paper. Form the seal again, recite the incantation, and inscribe a single character, completing the incantation and brushstroke. Blow the seal onto the character, place it on the afflicted person’s back, and command the divine generals to press it down.

**Alternative Method**
*Mount Tai’s foundation overturned, crushing the ghost without delay.*
*The Mighty Spirit pierces through the ear,*
*the ghostly fiend turns to mud.*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

The ritual master should face east, form the Mountain Character Seal with both hands, recite the incantation three times, and draw in a breath of *qi*. Envision the Mighty Spirit lifting Mount Tai and fiercely placing it upon the afflicted person’s head.

**Master Li’s Ghost-Subduing Method**
*Humbly invoke the divine spirits of Heaven and Earth,*
*the Five Agents—Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth—*
*the mighty Ghost Kings who communicate with the numinous,*
*the brave warriors who enact the method □□□□,*
*the Golden-Armored Generals, the mighty ritual warriors,*
*seize and hold it on both sides.*
*Master Li, the Perfected Lord, wields the sword in hand,*
*enacting the method to seize the malevolent.*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

Face north and perform the malevolent gesture. With the left hand, form the Dipper Seal, and with the right, press the *zǐ* trigram. Recite the incantation three times, draw in three breaths of *qi*, and blow them onto the afflicted person’s face. Command the divine generals to seize it. If instructed to strike, strike; if instructed to subdue, subdue.

**Burning Ghost Method**
*Humbly invoke the Generals of the Southern *bǐng-dīng*,*
*the Fire Bell Generals, the Heavenly Vajra Fire Gods,*
*the Great Fire Dragon Generals, the Fire Wheel Generals,*
*the Great Burning Ghost Generals—*
*swiftly burn the ghost for me!*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

The ritual master should face south, form the Fire Wheel Seal with both hands, recite the incantation three times, and draw in a breath of *qi* to blow onto the cinnabar ink and brush. Then, take a piece of black paper, form the Small Fire Seal with the left hand, and inscribe the Fire Wheel Talisman on the afflicted person’s back, commanding it to burn. When inscribing and burning the talisman, recite the following incantation:

**Fire Wheel Talisman**
*Within the heart, seven revolutions; the Twenty-Eight Constellations—*
*Humbly invoke the Lord of the Sun of the East,*
*secondly invoke the Lord of Fire Virtue of the South,*
*thirdly invoke the Fire Mountain Spirit of the West,*
*fourthly invoke the Great Fire Wheel of the North,*
*fifthly invoke the True Fire descending from the Center.*
*In my hand, I grasp the Great Fire Wheel,*
*burning the ghost’s body to nothingness.*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

Recite this in a single breath, completing the incantation and talisman.

**Four Rivers Freezing Malevolent Spirits Method**
*Humbly invoke the Source Lords of the Four Rivers,*
*the Great Gods of the Nine Rivers,*
*seize the icy souls of the malevolent,*
*swiftly freeze them!*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

The ritual master should face north, press the *zǐ* trigram with the right hand, and hold a bowl of pure water. Recite the incantation three times, draw in a breath of *qi*, and blow it into the water.

the Hastening Earth Spirit,

chunks.original_text: 先面北念法一遍，取炁吹於笔上，再念法书之，咒尽符成。 追魂法 谨请北帝大神，九天玉女，六丁六甲，天魔大王，左魂神将，右魄神将，速追真炁，速付真形。 急急如律令。 右法师向东，念法三遍，取炁三口，吹於患人身上。 次将黄纸二片，朱笔一管，念法一遍，取炁吹纸笔上。 以左手结六丁印，书追魂符二道。 以针签定，以纸灯烧为灰，用法水调下。 如患大段，不省人事。 牙关噤硬，心头热未绝者，急以符水灌於耳内，令一人将照子一面，於耳边打，高声叫姓名，少时即活。 当书追魂符时，念后咒。 追魂用 谨请六丁六甲神，六丁六甲将，赐五灵文。 追元辰，在东北。 怎去得，许昌摄。 念咒书符，咒尽笔尽。 移降法 奉请飞腾七降，赴体通名。 急召腾魂使者，速来腾魂。 急急如律令。 右此法为患人瘦弱，不禁驱考，即别唤一人，令与病人相对立。 先令患人吹炁，令立者人吸之。 两人并令合眼，法师面北，念法三遍，取炁吹患人头上。 复念法一遍，吸患人炁，吹於代人身上，喝：疾赴体。 又法 奉请黑路天神，与吾赴身，吾奉北帝勑。 右此法为小儿患语言不得，法师先令妳子抱孩儿，当面立吸孩儿炁一口，合眼。 法师以两手结金枪印，向北念法三遍，取炁三口，望面吹之。 喝神将速驱赴体。 加赴体，精神与常不同也。 抹块法 谨请六通大圣，大力天丁，助吾通灵，同共搜捉邪炁。 入笔不得动作。 吾奉上帝勑。

Master Yuanmiao Zong of the Cavernous Mystery, Compiler of *Tai Shang’s Orthodox Methods: Diagrams and Texts of Yu’s Steps, Dipper-Net Hand Seals, and Gaze Techniques*

The methods of Yu’s steps, Dipper-net hand seals, and gaze techniques constitute the great essentials of the Dao and the primordial discipline of its methods. The step-net rides upon the upright *qi* to govern beings; the seal-gaze operates through the divine mechanism to enact transformation. Whether cultivating immortality and refining the true, or summoning, commanding, and subduing, none can do without these.

Though earlier versions of the method texts recorded their outlines, omissions in practical application were not few. Here, I have compiled what has been transmitted to make them complete. May this modest effort encompass the vast, so that the marvels of the method families may be fully realized in their application.

**Method of Yu’s Steps and Dipper-Net Seals**

Yu’s steps emulate the images of creation and the movements of the sun and moon’s measured cycles. One month has three conjunctions; each conjunction spans three decades. These three decades are the three full numbers. One season has three conjunctions; these three conjunctions make nine decades. Thus, one step is one conjunction; one conjunction has three traces. Three steps yield nine traces, symbolizing one season. Bringing the feet together represents the celestial conjunction.

Raising the left foot first is the step of spring and autumn; raising the right foot first is the step of winter and summer. The first months of spring and autumn are yang phases; the first months of winter and summer are yin phases.

chunks.original_text: 故生杀制御用春秋收藏积聚用冬夏也。 又云：男当用春秋，女用冬夏也。 又云：三步九迹者，法步三元九炁也。 又十二迹者，法於律吕也。 又十五迹者，法三五之数也。 因用制宜之术，存乎法诀之轻重。 然而称禹步者，云大禹治水以成，厥功盖天。 真授此步诀，以制神召灵，遂因名为禹步耳。 凡步蹑之诀，存身为驱邪院使，正一法师，三元五德将军，吏兵功曹，师子白鹤，侍卫森列。 仍先念洗身咒，按经法，能以神存心步，尤为妙用，不必於形迹履践也。 经曰：禹步是禹受於太上，而演天纲地纪。 出为禹步，求真禁百物，人神龙鬼恶兽蛇毒之虫等，伏而勿杀。 拒而不伏者，诛之。 其理有并五斗作三步九迹，或十二迹，或三十五迹，或一十五迹。 又有顺倒返三匝之诀，列之于后。 如步七星，即从第一至第七，谓之顺行。 却从第之倒行。 复从第一至第七，谓之返行。 地户，从地户上天之义也。 三步九迹法 经曰：初为飞天纲蹑地纪禹步，翻为九迹，亦中斗数也，顺倒返三匝。 三遍履，不如三纲三度作步。 若欲急速得力，但三步履旧纲，左右各一遍，男重左，女重右。 左右讫，更须重。 遍亦则是三逼。 十二迹禹步法 三五迹禹步法 蹑地纪飞天纲法 右禹步飞天纲蹑地纪，并须倒返三遍为之。 经曰：行阴功助国护身救人者，先蹑地纪三遍讫，即飞天纲三遍，即散变三步九迹步，转天关击止之。 如恐不止，即十二步禹步一遍，又或步一十五步。 存上中下三将军兵众及六甲诸神等，转天关以指之。 如是三度，万事自消，亦不苦损阴灵物命。 若六度为之，所制立可陨灭，禁其妄行，损人功德。 经曰：步此有所制灭，并搯左右刀支诀。 在左右手第五指第三节上。 若治凶人，搯恶人刀支。 在右手第五指第三节上右边。 右主杀，左主生，不可妄行，切须察其理。 治恶鬼，摘鬼刀支。 在左手第五指第三节下。 经曰：凶神毒龙妖鬼，妄行狂风暴雨，伤损人物，不论水陆，须步蹑天纲地纪各三遍，散为禹步九迹，或十二，十五迹，或三返为之。 先九步，却返纲头，再为十二步，又返为十五步讫，左右配衣，左手把□星指之。 转天关，举手指之三或六或九，三度，毒妖自止。 六度，则致损病。 九度，必死灭。 虽为禁杀非道，亦不可不慎其理也。 度其妖祟，止则放，不可便杀。 若人物不安，水旱妖星，皆可禁治。 右天纲地纪三五禹步众图，事甩甚大，自各有经诀。 今略明其标要，所贵法家，知其奥‘妙之阶梯，识元真之阃阈也。 登步洗身咒 吾以日洗身，以月炼真。 仙人辅我，日月佐形。 二十八宿与吾合并，千邪万秽逐水而清。 急急如律令。 天地交泰禹步法 凡登禹步，先咒曰： 吾是洞中太一真，头戴七星步四灵。 手执金剑巽上立，迤通巡行直至坤。 地户巽宫须结界，直至天门谒帝君。 三步九迹登明星，三灾九厄离身形。 急急如律令。 凡禹步讫，念咒曰： 乾尊曜灵，坤顺内营。 二仪交泰，六合利贞。 配天亨地，永宁肃清。 应感元黄，上衣下裳。 震登艮兴，坎顺离明。 巽旺兑生，虎步龙骧。 天门地户，人门鬼门。 卫我者谁，昊天旻苍。 今日禹步，上应天纲。 鬼神宾伏，下辟不祥。 所求如愿，应时灵光。 急急如律令。 右步咒毕，如法随心行事。

Thus, life and death, control and command employ spring and autumn; storage and accumulation employ winter and summer. It is also said: men should use spring and autumn, while women should use winter and summer.

Moreover, the three steps and nine traces emulate the three origins and nine qi. The twelve traces emulate the twelve pitch-pipes. The fifteen traces emulate the numbers of three and five.

The art of adapting to circumstances lies in the subtleties of the method’s weight and measure. Yet it is called "Yu’s Steps" because Great Yu, in regulating the waters, accomplished a work that covered the heavens. He was truly bestowed this step-method to control spirits and summon numinous beings, hence it was named "Yu’s Steps."

In all step-treading methods, visualize the body as the Envoy of the Demon-Quelling Court, the Orthodox Unity Dharma Master, the Three Origins and Five Virtues General, the Clerk and Merit Officers, the Lion and White Crane, with an array of attendants standing guard.

First recite the Purification Mantra. According to the scriptural method, stepping with the mind focused on the spirit is especially efficacious; one need not rely solely on physical traces.

The scripture states: "Yu’s Steps were received by Yu from the Most High, unfolding the celestial net and earthly principles. Externally, they are Yu’s Steps, seeking the true and restraining the hundred things—humans, spirits, dragons, ghosts, evil beasts, venomous insects—subduing them without killing. Those who resist and do not submit are executed."

Its principles include combining the five dipper-stars into three steps and nine traces, or twelve traces, or thirty-five traces, or fifteen traces. There are also methods for reversing and circling three times, which are listed below.

When stepping the seven stars, proceed from the first to the seventh, called "forward progression." Then reverse from the seventh back. Return again from the first to the seventh, called "reverse progression." The "earthly gate" signifies ascending from the earthly gate to heaven.

**Method of Three Steps and Nine Traces**
The scripture states: "First, as the Flying Celestial Net treading the Earthly Principles, Yu’s Steps transform into nine traces, also corresponding to the Dipper’s numbers, circling forward, backward, and reverse three times. Stepping three times is not as effective as performing the Three Nets three times. If one seeks swift efficacy, simply step the old net three times, once on the left and once on the right—men emphasize the left, women the right. After completing left and right, repeat once more, totaling three presses."

**Method of Twelve-Trace Yu’s Steps**
**Method of Three-Five-Trace Yu’s Steps**
**Method of Treading Earthly Principles and Flying Celestial Net**
For Yu’s Steps of the Flying Celestial Net treading Earthly Principles, all must be performed in reverse three times.

The scripture states: "For those who perform hidden merits to aid the state, protect the body, and save others, first tread the Earthly Principles three times, then fly the Celestial Net three times, then disperse into the three-step, nine-trace Yu’s Steps, turning the Celestial Pivot to strike and halt. If fearing it will not stop, perform the twelve-step Yu’s Steps once, or step fifteen steps. Visualize the upper, middle, and lower Three Generals, their troops, and the Six Jia spirits, turning the Celestial Pivot to point at them. Doing this three times will dissolve all matters without harming the lives of yin spirits or creatures. If performed six times, what is controlled can be destroyed, restraining its reckless actions and diminishing one’s merit and virtue."

The scripture states: "When stepping to control or destroy, simultaneously form the Knife-Finger Seal with the left and right hands, on the third joint of the fifth finger. When dealing with violent people, form the Knife-Finger Seal for evil persons on the right side of the third joint of the right hand’s fifth finger. The right governs killing, the left governs life; do not act recklessly, and carefully examine the principles. To subdue evil ghosts, form the Ghost-Knife Seal on the underside of the third joint of the left hand’s fifth finger."

The scripture states: "For malevolent spirits, poisonous dragons, demonic ghosts causing reckless storms and violent rains that harm people and things, whether on water or land, step the Celestial Net and Earthly Principles each three times, dispersing into nine, twelve, or fifteen traces of Yu’s Steps, or perform three reversals. First nine steps, then reverse to the net’s head, then perform twelve steps, then reverse to fifteen steps. Align left and right with clothing, grasp the Dipper-Star with the left hand and point. Turn the Celestial Pivot, raising the hand to point three, six, or nine times, three rounds, and the poisonous demons will cease. Six rounds will cause harm and illness; nine rounds will result in death. Though this is a method of restraint and killing not of the Dao, one must not fail to be cautious in its principles. Assess the demonic affliction; if it ceases, release it, and do not kill immediately. If people and things are unsettled, or there are droughts, floods, or baleful stars, all can be restrained and governed."

The various diagrams of the Celestial Net, Earthly Principles, and Three-Five Yu’s Steps are of great importance, each with its own scriptural methods. Here, only the essentials are briefly outlined, so that practitioners of the method may know the ladder to its profound mysteries and recognize the threshold of the Original True.

**Purification Mantra for Ascending Steps**
"I purify my body with the sun, refine my true nature with the moon. Immortals assist me; sun and moon aid my form. The twenty-eight constellations unite with me; a thousand evils and ten thousand impurities are swept away by water and made clear. Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands."

**Method of Yu’s Steps for Heaven-Earth Harmony**
Whenever ascending Yu’s Steps, first recite the incantation:
"I am the Great One of the Grotto’s depths, my head bears the Seven Stars, my steps tread the Four Numinous Beasts. Grasping the golden sword, I stand in the Xun position, meandering in procession until I reach Kun. The earthly gate at Xun Palace must be sealed until I reach the Heavenly Gate to pay homage to the Emperor Lord. Three steps and nine traces ascend the Bright Star; the three disasters and nine calamities depart from my body. Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands."

After completing Yu’s Steps, recite the incantation:
"Qian honors the radiant spirit; Kun complies with the inner camp. The Two Modes harmonize; the Six Directions are auspicious and upright. Heaven and earth unite in prosperity; eternal peace and solemn clarity. Responding to the primordial yellow, above is the robe, below the skirt. Zhen ascends, Gen rises; Kan complies, Li shines. Xun flourishes, Dui generates; tiger steps and dragon soars. Heavenly Gate, Earthly Gate, Human Gate, Ghost Gate. Who guards me? The vast azure heavens. Today’s Yu’s Steps correspond to the Celestial Net above. Ghosts and spirits submit as guests; below, misfortune is repelled. What is sought is granted; the response is timely and numinous. Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands."

After reciting the step-incantations, proceed according to the method and follow the heart’s intent.

chunks.original_text: 交乾禹步法 诀曰： 坎双艮只步交乾，震上双行兑亦然。 坤只离单双步巽，三台归去便朝天。 右步毕，一结紫微印，乾上化身乘白鹤，飘飘至天门朝帝君，述心事奏达，乞赐敕命如愿，又再从天门返步归巽。 於诤室坛上，逐日子午时登坛，禹步亦可，披发仗剑，步向乾上，入坛心正坐，瞑目咒曰： 乾元亨利贞，日月蔽吾形。 万灾不能干，寿与天同龄。 急急如律令。 又咒曰： 吾是道门行法之主，水火刀兵不能及吾，疾病盗贼不能及吾。 吾与日月同光，所行万事吉昌。 急急如律令。 右步咒毕，如法行事。 既济禹步法阳日可用 未济禹步法阴日可用 右二步法，咒并同前。 步火铃斗诀斩摧一切凶神 火铃神咒 太上神铃，炎帝之精。 光霞电掣，明耀三清。 流火万里，鬼无逃形。 神印一着，灰灭邪精。 三五将军，豁落吏兵。 平天戛地，诛鬼不停。 飞符走印，头戴五星。 掷火前杀，万鬼千精。 六天鬼贼，付与神丁。 五灵真老，是吾本师。 无碍神通，万灵同归。 恶鬼绝灭，不祥速追。 中皇九道，威布四维。 伏匿故炁，不遗纤微。 五瘟七疰，吾能杀之。 何神敢逆，何鬼敢亏。 酆都戮形，北斗斩尸。 神印一着，万鬼消糜。 急急如大帝真君律令。 左手把印，右手把剑，念火铃咒七遍，一星一咒。 步相似北斗，初左步贪狼，次巨门右步，次禄存左点，次文曲左步，次廉贞右步，次武曲左步，次破军右步。 禄存星，勿令步履星上。 七星步，一步存一星，如金色於足下，七步只同也。 将印印有疑之处也。 印上一一涂好朱砂雄黄也。 步三台七星斗法凡救治事，可步此斗 入斗步法有所启祝遣勑之事，用此斗 凡步此斗，先念咒曰：我是天目，与天相逐。 精如雷电，光耀八极。 明彻表裹，无物不伏。 急急如律令。 凡步斗，入斗内。 有所启祝遣敕，并如本意施行。 如欲解秽治疾行事，即念净天地咒。 洞中玄虚，晃朗太元。 八方威神，使我自然。 灵宝符命，普告九天。 乾罗答那，侗罡太玄。 斩妖缚邪。 杀鬼万千。 中山神咒，元始玉文。 我诵一遍，却鬼延年。 按行五岳，八海知闻。 魔王束首，侍卫灵真。 凶秽荡净，道炁长存。 急急如律令。 又咒曰： 清清之水，日月华开。 中有北斗，内隐三台。 神水喷噀，祸去福来。 急急如律令。 又咒曰：

**Method of Intersecting Qian with Yu’s Steps**

Incantation:
*Kan’s double, Gen’s single step to intersect Qian;
Zhen’s ascent with double strides, Dui does the same.
Kun’s single, Li’s single and double step Xun;
Returning via the Three Terraces, one ascends to face Heaven.*

Upon completing the steps, form the Purple Tenuity Seal. Above Qian, transform the body and mount the white crane, drifting to the Heavenly Gate to pay homage to the Imperial Lord. Present the matters of the heart and petition for a decree to fulfill one’s wishes. Then retrace the steps from the Heavenly Gate back to Xun.

Within the oratory or altar, ascend the platform daily at the hours of *zi* and *wu*. Yu’s Steps may be employed. Dishevel the hair and wield the sword, stepping toward Qian. Enter the altar, sit with upright heart, close the eyes, and intone:

*Qian’s origin, prosperity, advantage, and steadfastness;
Sun and moon conceal my form.
Ten thousand calamities cannot assail me;
My lifespan equals Heaven’s.*

Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

Again, intone:
*I am the master of Daoist ritual practice.
Water, fire, blades, and weapons cannot reach me;
Sickness and thieves cannot approach me.
I shine with the same light as sun and moon;
All I undertake prospers.*

Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

Upon completing the step-incantation, proceed according to the method.

**Ji Ji Yu’s Steps Method** may be used on yang days.
**Wei Ji Yu’s Steps Method** may be used on yin days.
The incantations for these two step-methods are the same as above.

**Fire Bell Dipper Steps to Slay and Subdue All Malevolent Spirits**

**Fire Bell Spirit Incantation:**
*Supreme Divine Bell, essence of the Flame Emperor.
Radiance like lightning, illuminating the Three Clarities.
Raging fire spans ten thousand *li*; ghosts cannot escape their forms.
With one imprint of the divine seal, perverse spirits are reduced to ashes.
Generals of the Three and Five, officers and soldiers of the Vast Expanse.
Leveling Heaven and striking Earth, they ceaselessly slay ghosts.
Flying talismans and swift seals, crowned with the Five Stars.
Hurl fire to slay ahead; ten thousand ghosts and a thousand spirits.
Ghosts and thieves of the Six Heavens are delivered to the divine soldiers.
The Five Numinous True Elders are my original masters.
Unobstructed divine power; all spirits return in unison.
Evil ghosts are annihilated; misfortune is swiftly pursued.
The Nine Paths of the Central August One spread might to the four directions.
Lurking old *qi* is eradicated, not a trace remains.
The Five Pestilences and Seven Afflictions—I can slay them.
What spirit dares oppose? What ghost dares transgress?
Their forms are executed in Fengdu; their corpses are severed by the Northern Dipper.
With one imprint of the divine seal, ten thousand ghosts dissolve to dust.*

Swiftly, swiftly, as the True Lord of the Great Emperor commands.

Grasp the seal in the left hand and the sword in the right. Recite the Fire Bell Incantation seven times, one star per incantation. Step in the likeness of the Northern Dipper: first, left step to *Tanlang*; next, right step to *Jumen*; then, left point to *Luxing*; next, left step to *Wenqu*; then, right step to *Lianzhen*; next, left step to *Wuqu*; finally, right step to *Pojun*. For the *Luxing* star, do not step directly upon it. With each of the seven steps, visualize a star as golden beneath the feet—all seven steps are identical. Imprint the seal upon any doubtful location, applying cinnabar and realgar to the seal.

**Three Terraces Seven Stars Dipper Method** may be employed for all healing and salvific matters.
**Entering the Dipper Step Method** is used for petitions, summons, and decrees.

For all steps of this Dipper, first recite the incantation:
*I am the Heavenly Eye, following Heaven’s course.
My essence is like thunder and lightning, illuminating the eight extremities.
Bright and penetrating within and without, nothing does not submit.*

Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

When stepping the Dipper, enter its bounds. For petitions, summons, or decrees, proceed according to one’s original intent. If purifying defilement, healing illness, or performing rituals, recite the *Purifying Heaven and Earth Incantation*:

*Within the cavern, profound and void; resplendent and vast, the Supreme Origin.
Mighty spirits of the eight directions, render me natural.
Numinous treasure talismanic command, universally proclaimed to the Nine Heavens.
Qianluo Danna, the mighty *gang* of the Supreme Mystery.
Slay demons and bind perversity; slay a thousand ghosts.
Zhongshan spirit incantation, original jade script of the Primordial Beginning.
Reciting it once repels ghosts and extends years.
Marching through the Five Marchmounts, known to the Eight Seas.
Demon kings bow their heads; divine perfected attend and guard.
Malevolence and defilement are cleansed; the Dao’s *qi* endures eternally.*

Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

Again, intone:
*Limpid water, blossoming with the essence of sun and moon.
Within lies the Northern Dipper, concealing the Three Terraces.
Divine water sprayed and sprinkled; misfortune departs, fortune arrives.*

Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

Again, intone:

chunks.original_text: 吾左目为日，右目为月。 日为将军，月为司马。 五使喷水治秽，无不除者。 扫除凶妖、辟除五恶。 百秽之鬼，速走万里。 急急如律令。 如治病解秽毕，使出斗禹步，念禹步咒。 至病人所念天蓬杀鬼等咒，以法水贲治之。 凡步斗行事毕，出斗咒曰： 五行相催，刚剑持威。 六甲辅我，三台辟非。 天回地转，阴阳开辟。 长生度世，日月同辉。 急急如律令。 步豁落斗法 步豁落斗咒诀 斗要妙兮，十二辰。 承天纲兮，威武陈。 炁仿髴兮，如浮云。 七炁度兮，上应天。 知变化兮，有时日。 入斗宿兮，度天关。 六甲律兮，持合乙。 履天英兮，乘天任。 傍天柱兮，拥天心。 从兹度兮，过天禽。 傍天辅兮，望天冲。 入天内兮，出天蓬。 斗道要兮，刚柔济。 添福禄兮，留后世。 出幽冥兮，千万岁。 急急如律令。 右此斗如详度，临时有所施为。 步毕，随意别念咒法。 步三摄纲法 三摄纲，乃北神三摄纲，诛一切精邪鬼魅，瘟黄之鬼。 步雷火斗法 一转搯寅。

My left eye is the sun, my right eye the moon.
The sun serves as general, the moon as marshal.
The Five Agents spray water to purge defilement—nothing remains unremoved.
Sweep away malevolent spirits, dispel the Five Evils.
Ghosts of every defilement swiftly flee ten thousand leagues.

Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

When treating illness or resolving impurity is complete, step forth from the Dipper with Yu’s Pace, reciting the Pace of Yu incantation. At the afflicted one’s place, intone the Heavenly Peng demon-slaying and other incantations, then administer the ritual water to cure.

Upon completing the Dipper-stepping rite, exit the Dipper with this incantation:
The Five Phases spur one another; the rigid sword wields might.
The Six Jia assist me; the Three Terraces ward off wrong.
Heaven revolves, earth turns; yin and yang open and part.
Attain long life, transcend the world; sun and moon shine as one.

Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

**Stepping the Huoluo Dipper Method**
**Incantation and Formula for Stepping the Huoluo Dipper**

Essential is the Dipper, the twelve celestial hours.
Upholding heaven’s net, martial might arrays.
*Qi* flickers and shifts like floating clouds.
The Seven *Qi* ascend, corresponding to heaven above.
Know transformation—there is a time and season.
Enter the Dipper’s lodging, cross the heavenly pass.
The Six Jia’s rhythm holds, uniting with Yi.
Tread upon Heavenly Ying, mount Heavenly Ren.
Flank Heavenly Pillar, embrace Heavenly Heart.
From here traverse, pass Heavenly Qín.
Beside Heavenly Fǔ, gaze toward Heavenly Chōng.
Enter Heavenly Inner, exit Heavenly Péng.
Essential is the Dipper’s Way—hard and soft harmonize.
Augment fortune and emolument, leave them for posterity.
Emerge from darkness, live for a thousand myriad years.

Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

When this Dipper is meticulously traversed, apply it as needed in the moment. Upon completing the steps, recite other incantations and methods at will.
